titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn trolley lines blueprints 1977.286
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:28 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection consists of 80 blueprints of Brooklyn trolley lines, showing schematics of electrical power feeder lines and trolley connections. The blueprints were issued by the New York City Board of Transportation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn trolley lines blueprints, 1977.286, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
